post.description:
Join the first publicly available session of given type. If there is no public session, and the session type
permits player made sessions, create a new session and put the player in it

Required Permissions: 
	For any player (including themselves)any of: `session:*`, `session:create`


Required Session Permissions: None

get.description:
Get Session by ID. This request will return limited results for non-members of the session, such as excluding info for 
how to connect to the instance. Elevated permissions can bypass that restriction

Required Permissions: 
	For any player (including themselves)any of: `session:*`, `session:read:any`, `session:read:self`


Required Session Permissions: None for limited results. `SessionPermissions.active_in_session` to get complete results for users who do not have the `session:read:any` auth permission

post.description:

patch.description:
Update info about the instance. If the instance was a result of the instance allocation system, then it will have an allocation id.
Allocated instances must send their allocation id for updates to ensure they are still the proper allocation.

Required Permissions: 
	For any player (including themselves)any of: `session:*`, `session:update:self`, `session:update:any`

             
Required Session Permissions: `SessionPermissions.session_host` if user does not have the `session:update:any` auth permission

post.description:
Begin a new match for the current session, on the current instance

Required Permissions: 
	For any player (including themselves)any of: `session:*`, `session:update:self`, `session:update:any`

             
Required Session Permissions: `SessionPermissions.session_admin` if user does not have the `session:update:any` auth permission

delete.description:
Unregister the match from the session.

	For any player (including themselves)any of: `session:*`, `session:update:self`, `session:update:any`

             
Required Session Permissions: `SessionPermissions.session_admin` if user does not have the `session:update:any` auth permission

patch.description:

Retry-After.description: Number of seconds after which to retry the request

double_args.title: Double Args
double_args.description: Additional double arguments to add to the matchmaking ticket

string_args.title: String Args
string_args.description: Additional string arguments to add to the matchmaking ticket

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Additional tags to add to the matchmaking ticket

extensions.title: Extensions
extensions.description: Additional extensions to add to the matchmaking ticket. Value is a base64 string representation of the protobuf binary data. The data will be converted back to binary before being put on the ticket

AdditionalJoinParams.title: AdditionalJoinParams
AdditionalJoinParams.description: Additional parameters to apply to a matchmaking ticket

custom_data.title: Custom Data
custom_data.description: Custom data with the listing of the instance in the Session browser

BrowserInfo.title: BrowserInfo
BrowserInfo.description: Information about the browser resource in a session

cursor.title: Cursor
cursor.description: Cursor to continue iterating through browser sessions. 0 means we have returned the last entry

browser_sessions.title: Browser Sessions
browser_sessions.description: List of sessions in the browser

BrowserResponse.title: BrowserResponse
BrowserResponse.description: A response with a list of browsers, and a cursor to continue iterating through them

custom_data.title: Custom Data
custom_data.description: Custom data with the listing of the instance in the Session browser

BrowserSessionInfo.title: BrowserSessionInfo
BrowserSessionInfo.description: Information about a session listed in a browser

platform_id.description: DEPRECATED. Use 'platform' instead. Id for which platform this client is on. ID will be ignored if 'platform' is given. At least one of the two is required

platform.description: Which platform this client is on. If one is not provided, will get the platform from the 'platform_id'. At least one of the two is required

input.description: Which input type this client is using

ClientSettings.title: ClientSettings
ClientSettings.description: A player's platform and input settings

ConnectionInfo.title: ConnectionInfo
ConnectionInfo.description: Connection info about the requesting client

client_version.title: Client Version
client_version.description: String representation of semver for client

client_settings.title: Client Settings
client_settings.description: Which input type and platform the client is using

crossplay_preferences.title: Crossplay Preferences
crossplay_preferences.description: Client's desired crossplay settings to determine which other clients it can play with. If not defined, assumed to be as permissive as possible

session_type.title: Session Type
session_type.description: Type of session client is creating or joining

region_id.title: Region Id
region_id.description: Preferred region for the instance and match to take place in

CreateOrJoinRequest.title: CreateOrJoinRequest
CreateOrJoinRequest.description: A request body for a player to join a session

CrossplayInput.title: CrossplayInput
CrossplayInput.description: Crossplay input preferences. Used to determine whether players can queue together, and the pools of players that are used to generate matches
x-enum-descriptions: No crossplay input preferences. Can play with players using any input
Can only play with players using a keyboard and mouse
Can only player with players using a gamepad/controller
Can only player with players using a touch screen

CrossplayPlatform.title: CrossplayPlatform
CrossplayPlatform.description: Crossplay platform preferences. Used to determine whether players can queue together, and the pools of players that are used to generate matches
x-enum-descriptions: No crossplay platform preferences. Can play with players any platforms
Can only play with players on xbox-like platforms (xbox-one, xsx etc.)
Can only play with players on playstation-like platform (ps4, ps5 etc.)

permitted_platform.description: The platform type that the client is allowed to play with (any, xbox-like only, playstation-like only etc.)

permitted_input.description: The input type that the client is allowed to play with (keyboard and mouse, gamepad, touch input etc.)

CrossplayPreferences.title: CrossplayPreferences
CrossplayPreferences.description: A session's or player's preferences around crossplay platforms and inputs. Permitted platforms and inputs will be checked when new players attempt to join a session

Determiner.title: Determiner
Determiner.description: Determiner for how many rules must be satisfied in order to satisfy the ruleset
x-enum-descriptions: All rules must be satisfied
At least one rule must be satisfied
Exactly one rule must be satisfied
All rules must not be satisfied

FubarResponse.title: FubarResponse
FubarResponse.description: Response to successfully marking an instance as FUBAR

MMRGroupingMethod.title: MMRGroupingMethod
MMRGroupingMethod.description: What method should be used to determine a linking's group MMR based on the individuals
x-enum-descriptions: Use the lowest MMR of any player in the linking
Use the highest MMR of any player in the linking
Use the arithmetic mean of the players' skill multiplied by their variance. This is the sum of each player's skill times variance divided by the number of players
Use the arithmetic mean of the players' skill. This is the sum of each player's skill divided by the number of players

SessionPlayerUpdateResponse.description: Response to a reques tto update a player in a session

max_size.title: Max Size
max_size.description: Maximum number of players allowed on this team

SessionTeam.title: SessionTeam
SessionTeam.description: A team of SessionPlayers in a session

engine_session_type.title: Engine Session Type
engine_session_type.description: Engine identifier for sessions of this type.  For UE, this is commonly `Party` or `Game`.

can_join_matchmaking.title: Can Join Matchmaking
can_join_matchmaking.description: Are sessions of this type allowed to join matchmaking?

can_be_created_by_players_directly.title: Can Be Created By Players Directly
can_be_created_by_players_directly.description: Are players allowed to create sessions of this type?

joinable.title: Joinable
joinable.description: Should players join existing sessions of this type before creating a new one

auto_add_to_browser.title: Auto Add To Browser
auto_add_to_browser.description: Should session be automatically added to the browser list

auto_browser_params.title: Auto Browser Params
auto_browser_params.description: Browser parameters that can be used to filter results

can_be_added_to_server_browser.title: Can Be Added To Server Browser
can_be_added_to_server_browser.description: Are sessions of this type able to be added to the server browser by players?

keep_alive_on_empty.title: Keep Alive On Empty
keep_alive_on_empty.description: Should the session stay around, or be destroyed when the last player leaves it?

platform_templates.title: Platform Templates
platform_templates.description: Platform-Specific session mappings that are used to coordinate Rally Here sessions with OnlineSubsystem sessions

auto_startup_params.title: Auto Startup Params
auto_startup_params.description: Parameters used to start an instance for this session when it is created

min_session_count.title: Min Session Count
min_session_count.description: Minimum number of this type of session to be running at any given time per region.

custom_data.title: Custom Data
custom_data.description: Product-defined custom data about this session type

num_teams.title: Num Teams
num_teams.description: The number of teams this session type can have

players_per_team.title: Players Per Team
players_per_team.description: The number of players that can be on each team

can_change_own_team.title: Can Change Own Team
can_change_own_team.description: Whether or not a player can change which team they are on. If true, they are able to. If False, they player's team can only be changed by an admin

SessionTemplate.title: SessionTemplate
SessionTemplate.description: Template used to create new RallyHere sessions of a specific type. Configurable in the developer portal

templates.title: Templates
templates.description: Dictionary of SessionTemplates keyed on their template type

SessionTemplates.title: SessionTemplates
SessionTemplates.description: A mapping of RallyHere session template types to the templates

region_id.title: Region Id
region_id.description: Preferred region for the instance and match to take place in

custom_data.title: Custom Data
custom_data.description: Leader Player or instance defined custom data about this session

joinable.title: Joinable
joinable.description: Flag for if players can freely join this session without an invite

SessionUpdate.title: SessionUpdate
SessionUpdate.description: A request body to update information about a session resource

tags.name: Sessions
tags.description:
This API is for the creation and management of sessions, which are just generic groups of players, and operations
on those sessions, such as joining matchmaking.

tags.name: Queues
tags.description:
The queue endpoints are for requesting information and configuration about queues, instance launch templates, and
matchmaking profiles

tags.name: Regions
tags.description: Region endpoints for clients to request client visible regions and configuration around them
